required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) in Patients With Solid Tumors Harboring an NRG1 Fusion
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Study of MCLA-128, a Full Length IgG1 Bispecific Antibody Targeting HER2 and HER3, in Patients With Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase I/II, open-label, multi-center, multi-national, dose escalation, single agent study to assess the safety, tolerability, PK, PD, immunogenicity and anti-tumor activity of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) in patients with solid tumors harboring an NRG1 fusion.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study Design :
This open label (all participants know the identity of the study drug), multicenter (more than one study site), first-in-human study consisting of 2 parts. Part 1 is a dose escalation and Part 2 is a dose expansion cohort. Part 1 has been completed.
Part 2 new patient populations examined:
- Group F: Patients with NSCLC with documented NRG1 fusion
- Group G: Patients with pancreatic cancer with documented NRG1 fusion
- Group H: Patients with any other solid tumor with documented NRG1 fusion
For these new patient populations, Part 2 will further characterize the safety and tolerability of the selected dose level of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128), as well as assessment of CBR, defined as the proportion of patients with a CR, PR or durable SD (SD for at least 12 weeks in duration). For the new patient populations, overall response rate (ORR) and duration of response (DOR) will be described.
The study consists of 3 periods: Screening period (up to 28 days prior to the first dose of study drug); Treatment period (treatment cycles of 28 days); and Follow Up period (through 30 days after the last dose and quarterly checks for survival data for up to 2 years). Participants' safety will be monitored throughout the study.
Number of Sites:
Up to 40 sites are estimated to be involved during Parts 1 and 2 of the study. Additional sites may be added to ensure there is an acceptable enrollment rate or to replace non-enrolling/withdrawn sites.

primary_outcome.measure: Characterize the safety and tolerability of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Adverse Events (AE) and Serious Adverse Events (SAE)
Evaluation of clinical benefit assessed by RECIST v1.1 determining objective overall response rate (ORR)
Evaluation of clinical benefit assessed by RECIST v1.1 determining duration of response (DOR)

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of anti-tumor activity and biomarkers
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the correlation between the anti-tumor activity of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) and HER2

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of anti-tumor activity and biomarkers
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the correlation between the anti-tumor activity of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) and HER3

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of anti-tumor activity and biomarkers
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the correlation between the anti-tumor activity of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) and Heregulin

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of anti-tumor activity and biomarkers
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the correlation between the anti-tumor activity of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) and disease related biomarkers (i.e. CA19-9)

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate severity, frequency and duration of Adverse events
Assess the volume of distribution of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of distribution at steady state [Vss]
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the volume of distribution of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) at steady state

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration versus time curve from time zero to time t [AUC0-t]
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the Area under the concentration versus time curve from time zero to time t [AUC0-t] of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)

secondary_outcome.measure: area under the concentration versus time curve [AUC0-∞]
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the area under the concentration versus time curve [AUC0-∞] of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
Assess the time to reach maximum concentration [tmax] of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of anti-drug antibodies against zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the Incidence of anti-drug antibodies against zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128)
Assess serum titers of anti-drug antibodies

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-tumor response of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) by RECIST v1.1
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the anti-tumor response of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) by RECIST v1.1
CBR assessed as the proportion of patients in whom a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) is observed (where SD duration is a minimum of 12 weeks) by RECIST v1.1 .
Evaluation of clinical benefit assessed by RECIST v1.1 determining objective progression-free survival (PFS) and/or survival

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 2 Pancreatic cancer harboring NRG1 fusion
arm_group.description: Participants will receive intravenous infusion of 750 mg of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) (the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D)) every 2 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 2 NSCLC cancer harboring NRG1 fusion
arm_group.description: Participants will receive intravenous infusion of 750 mg of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) (the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D)) every 2 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Part 2 Solid tumour (basket) harboring NRG1 fusion
arm_group.description: Participants will receive intravenous infusion of 750 mg of zenocutuzumab (MCLA-128) (the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D)) every 2 weeks.

intervention.description: full length IgG1 bispecific antibody targeting HER2 and HER3

Part 2 Pancreatic cancer harboring NRG1 fusion
Part 2 Solid tumour (basket) harboring NRG1 fusion
